questions.text: Some fans feel that sports events are exciting only when the competitors are of equal ability, making the outcome of the game ______.
The consumer advocate claimed that while drug manufacturers tout the supposed advantages of their proprietary brands, generic versions of the same medications are often equally _______.
The bearded dragon lizard is a voracious eater, so _____ that it will consume as many insects as possible.
Because drummer Tony Williams paved the way for later jazz-fusion musicians, he is considered a ______ of that style.
The politician’s speech to the crowd was composed of nothing but ________, a bitter railing against the party’s opponents.
Favoring economy of expression in writing, the professor urged students toward a spare rather than an ______ prose style.
The new antifungal agent has such varied uses, from treating Dutch elm disease to rescuing water-damaged works of art from molds, that it is considered one of the more ____ antibiotics.
Physical exercise often has a ______ effect, releasing emotional tension and refreshing the spirit.
Because rap and hip-hop offer such ______ commentary on contemporary issues, they are often said to be sharp-edged musical genres.
As a child, Mary _____ her stringent upbringing; however, as she grew older she began to appreciate her grandmother’s strict discipline.
Since other seabirds customarily nest in colonies on ocean cliffs and islands, the marbled murrelet’s predilection for nesting in forests many miles from the sea must be considered ______.

The cause of Mozart’s demise is a long-standing medical _______: over the years, physicians have suggested more than 100 possibilities, including poisoning, malnutrition, kidney disease, and heart failure.
At first the children were _____, but as the morning progressed they began to laugh and talk eagerly.
Oren missed the play’s overarching significance, focusing instead on details so minor that they would best be described as _______.
Her political success came from her ______ vision of the nation, a vision that included and drew strength from every social constituency.
As one would expect, the reclusive poet _____ public appearances and invasions of privacy.
In the classroom, Carol was unusually ____; on the playground, however, she became as intractable as the other children.
Bubble gum is not a topic usually treated seriously, so it is appropriate that this new book tracing the cultural history of bubble gum has a _____ tone.
Jamake Highwater manages to touch on the arts of almost every American Indian nation in one reasonably sized book that makes up for its occasional lack of _____ with its remarkable inclusiveness.
Though Judd is typically ______ and reserved in social gatherings, at last night’s reception he spoke and acted with uncharacteristic eloquence.
Fanatically committed to one political cause, Anderson was a _______, maintaining an exclusively partisan outlook.
The author’s theory about modern design had an enormous impact when first published, but as influential as it was then, it is now clearly _______.
Texas is known for its wild orchids, whose diversity is evident in their ______ colors: 52 species have been catalogued, ranging from pure white to bright red.
In 1974 the committee overseeing the Pulitzer Prize in Literature was racked with so much _____ that it bestowed no award at all that year.
Pablo Picasso was _____ youth:his extraordinary artistic talent was obvious at a very early age.
Jared has the habits of _____: he lives simply and donates most of his income to local charities.
The simple and direct images in Dorothea Lange's photographs provide _____ reflection of a bygone social milieu.
Kate’s impulsive nature and sudden whims led her friends to label her ______.
Neurosurgeon Alexa Canady maintained that choosing a career was a visceral decision rather than _______ judgment; that is, it was not so much rational as instinctive.
Creative business stratagems frequently become _______ as a result of bureaucratization, their versatility and adaptability destroyed by their transformation into rigid policies.
Known for her _______, Miranda eagerly welcomes anyone into her home.
The ambassador argues that, in diplomacy, there is a subtle but important difference between a country’s showing a willingness to _______ and a too- obvious readiness to make concessions.
The dancer’s performing style was ______ and inept, with each move taken from another artist, and poorly executed at that.
Lewis Latimer's inexpensive method of producing carbon filaments transformed the nascent electric industry by making electric lamps commercially ______.
After winning the award, Phillip adopted a haughty pose, treating even his best friends in a _____ manner.
The general was so widely suspected of _____ during the war that his name eventually became synonymous with disloyalty.
The prose of Richard Wright’s autobiographical Black Boy (1945) is _______, free of stylistic tricks or evasiveness.
Although the theory that widespread lead poisoning contributed to the decline of the Roman Empire has gained ______, the evidence is still inconclusive.
Professor Williams disdained tradition: she regularly attacked cherished beliefs and institutions, earning a reputation as _____.
Although the editors were reputed to be very ________, the uneven quality of the material they put into the anthology suggests they were too inclusive.
The professor’s presentation was both ______ and enlightening: though brief, it was instructive.
The judge’s published opinions, though sophisticated and subtle, were undeniably _____: they left no doubt of her intentions.
A certain additive put in gasoline to reduce air pollution is actually contaminating groundwater, a finding that shows that even the most well- intentioned fixes can sometimes ______.
The biologist’s description of the wolf pack was truly _______, devoid of any emotion or personal prejudice.
No longer considered tenable, the belief that all of Puerto Rico’s indigenous Taino people perished centuries ago appears to be a ______ now that modern Taino descendants have come forward.
Although aging brings about profound physiological changes, it does not often alter an individual’s _____: an irascible thirty year old will probably still be cantankerous at seventy.
The commentator characterized the electorate as ______ because it was unpredictable and given to constantly shifting moods.
The pharmaceutical company insisted that its testing of new drugs was quite ______, more rigorous than the industry standard.
Freedom of expression is not necessarily a _____ force: communities that encourage it often feel less threatened by social unrest than do those in which dissent is restricted.
Thomas Hardy’s novels are described as ______ because of their preoccupation with daily life in rural and agricultural settings.
Some skeptics consider the Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence (SETI) to be ______ even foolish; others go so far as to accuse SETI scientists of outright chicanery in applying skewed data.
One requirement of timeless art is that it deepen and _____ our awareness, not that it merely confirm what we already know.
Despairing that the performance of the chief executive would ever improve, the corporation’s board of directors took decisive action and _____ him.
The discovery of the fossil was startling and _______, surprising scientists and undermining accepted theories about plant distribution.
Far from being aggressive, bears in some national parks are surprisingly _____ when approached by humans; still, visitors must exercise caution.
Before becoming a stockbroker,Victoria Woodhull had a career as a ______, someone believed to have insights about events beyond ordinary human perception.
The judges for the chili competition were _______, noting subtle differences between dishes that most people would not detect.
Although the archaeologist _____ the symbols on the cave wall, she was unable to decipher them because they were too faint.
Popular interest in music performed by folk singer Jean Ritchie acted as a ______ because it stirred a wider interest in the music of Ritchie’s native Kentucky.
Oceanographers have identified more than 50 “dead zones" around the world: areas of sea that various forms of pollution have rendered _____ life.
The few female physicians practicing at the end of the nineteenth century might be considered ______ because they constituted a very small percentage of all physicians.
Rose smiled approvingly but gave neither written nor spoken permission to proceed with the project: her consent, in short, was ______.
Paradoxically, during the French Revolution, the very leaders who proclaimed _______ philosophies sometimes also engaged in repressive practices.
Despite his brilliant career, Gerald was plagued by doubts and could not dispel his feelings of _______.
Jane was both ______ and impudent: she was blatantly proud and offensively bold.
New Zealand and Spain can accurately be described as _______ because they are diametrically opposite one another on the globe.
Ken took his ______ obligations seriously, patiently caring for his mother throughout her long recuperation.
The sound produced by the youth orchestra was so ______ that even its least experienced members were abashed.
By discovering how to create an affordable substitute for cortisone from soybeans, Percy Julian helped to make arthritis treatment _____ large numbers of people.

Although the women in the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries who undertook botanical illustration were primarily amateurs, their contributions as naturalists and cataloguers actually helped ______ the field as an academic discipline.
To end his lecture on time, Professor Burke decided to ______ his final point and address it instead at the next class meeting.
Although A.S. Byatt’s stories are elaborate and sometimes contain supernatural elements, her characters do not seem _______; on the contrary, they are quite plausible.
Dr. Allan was told informally of several intriguing cases that accorded with her theory, but this _____ evidence could not provide the confirmation that a more systematic series of experiments would.
Despite the profusion of books written about Greta Garbo, she ultimately remains _____, an inscrutable personality.
The editor did not wish to print an article based on mere _______; she therefore ordered the reporter to find convincing proof.
Linda is ______ in matters large and small: she is inflexible in her opinions and utterly resistant to persuasion.
Jason was truly ______, for he squandered a great deal of money with no thought for the future.
The 1990’s were ______ years for the organization: the staff was happy, customers were satisfied, and profits were excellent.
Lumbee storyteller Barbara Braveboy-Locklear has performed in college theaters, powwows, and backyards, settings whose striking diversity highlights the ______ appeal that storytelling holds.
Claudia is so adept at controlling her temper that she can seem quite placid when she is actually _____.
The young man possessed _____ disposition, abjectly submissive to the will of others.
Although other European states broke apart under the stresses of political upheaval, the seventeenth-century Dutch republic proved remarkably ______.
It is her supremely skillful use of sophisticated laboratory instruments that makes Veronica the _____ research technician that she is.
Momentum gathered for a new property tax, but the ______ from home owners was so great that this proposal had to be abandoned.
Most of the students found the lecturers speech ______; in fact, it was so dull that some even nodded off.
The attempts of epidemiologists to contain the infectious disease ultimately proved futile: as soon as they managed to ______ it in one community, it would emerge somewhere else.
The accused affected a _____ air during the interview; he made no vehement protestation of innocence, just a perfunctory denial of guilt.
The award-winning novel is such _____ tale that its very intricacy has a daunting effect on readers.
Marketing firms rely heavily on ______ information: statistical data about the size, growth, and distribution of human populations.
Electing not to stay in subordinate positions in large firms, some attorneys ______, seeking more autonomy and independence elsewhere.
The kiwi bird’s wings are ______: that is, they are rudiments of wings and serve no function.
Because all members of this organization are idealists, they denounce any assertion that political enterprises should be purely ______.
The critic noted that the ______ tone that characterizes much of the writer’s work stands in stark contrast to his gentle disposition.
Peter was resolute without being ______: he held fast to his beliefs but avoided arguing about them with others.
African American poet Lucille Clifton writes in a notably _____ style, achieving great impact in a few unadorned words.
Unlike some entertainers whose performances rarely vary, jazz great Louis Armstrong frequently _______ during his performances, spontaneously introducing new phrasing in existing songs.
Not wanting to speak prematurely, Julia _____ the urge to announce her scientific findings until she had double-checked the data.
Some readers find the crime fiction of Patricia Highsmith to be ______ because her protagonists are not always punished for their transgressions.
People did not suddenly learn to use fire, but did so slowly over time with countless advances offset by _____ periods.
Hoping to preserve natural habitats, conservationists lobbied for legislation that would _____ commercial development in these areas.
Because her new job required daily attendance, Joan was obliged to ______ her formerly itinerant lifestyle as a traveling musician.
As scientists at the Smithsonian have observed, the institution’s range of scientific inquiry may be vast, but its financial resources are far less _______.
As advocates of free speech confront those who would regulate entertainment strictly, the debate over shocking content in movies will likely _______.
The author’s love of harmonious and pleasing sounds was reflected in the _______ phrases of her fiction.
The respect accorded choreographer Martha Graham by her students and colleagues alike was so great that it amounted to ________.
The speaker announced that her primary focus would be on broad global concerns rather than on ______ issues.
The scientist warned that global warming might stimulate a dangerous ______ of some mosquito-borne diseases, resulting in an increasing number of epidemics around the world.
The seventeenth and eighteenth centuries were the era when Pueblo pottery was least likely to be ______ and from which, consequently, the fewest authentic examples survive.
Some psychologists argue that a _______ of choices can be paralyzing, since too many options can impede meaningful selection.
His goal was to _______ the committee’s deliberations, and a measure of his success was the ease with which a decision was reached.
The Classical Age of Greece, 500 B.C. to 323 B.C., was characterized by contradictions: it was a mix of superstition and ______, of revolutionary concepts and centuries-old traditions.
Celia Tomlinson personifies _____: she overcame poverty, language barriers, and discrimination to found, own, and operate her own engineering company.
The crude animated effects afforded by projected images from seventeenth-century lantern slides have now been recognized as ______ of modern film animation.
The ______ of impact craters on Venus suggests that erosion may have smoothed its surface over the past billion years.
Certain clear patterns in the metamorphosis of a butterfly indicate that the process is ______.
The book’s final chapter on Mildred Imach Cleghorn suffers from an obvious ______: it fails to cover Cleghorn’s years as an Apache tribal leader.
To keep their negotiations secret, the leaders of rival groups in the country arranged meetings that were ________.
Darren’s sensitivity to his celebrity clients is nothing short of _______: he is able to anticipate their needs before they themselves are fully aware of them.
Detractors attacked the study’s _____, claiming that researchers used lax procedures to gather and analyze data.
The musical Scrambled Egg _____ the denizens of the theatrical world, poking fun at actors, directors, play wrights, and audiences alike.
Though the work of celebrated artist Eugene Delacroix ______ accolades from both art critics and the public, he remains an enigma, someone shrouded in mystery.
Gwendolyn Brooks was _____ writer: she wrote more than twenty books of poetry as well as numerous essays and reviews.
His book on the history of science is admittedly conventional, perhaps even _____ ; nevertheless, it is edifying work that covers a formidable amount of ground.
The executive was faulted for acting _____, for implementing sweeping changes without fully considering what the consequences might be.
In the United States, social activists who strongly object to a particular law can attempt to obtain a constitutional amendment to _____ it.
Because Alex was a very _____ person, he found satisfaction only in work that involved intellectual stimulation.
Readers of history often marvel that momentous events were triggered by actions that seemed _____ at the time.
Place-names can be strikingly ______ : there is, for example, nothing particularly odd about the town of Peculiar, Missouri.
Such was Norton’s generosity that he was at times criticized for being _____ to a fault.
Identifying Luisa Capetillo only with the early labor union movement in Puerto Rico ______ the cosmopolitan nature of her career: she also worked in Florida, New York, and Cuba.
The singer displays her sensitivity to delicate shades of meaning and feeling in the recording: her performance is a model of ______.
More concerned with contributing to science than with earning public acclaim, nineteenth-century astronomer Caroline Herschel _____ the recognition she received for her achievements.
The art professor was never one to _____: she always stuck closely to the subject of every lecture.
A researcher who described a peaceful reunion between normally adversarial chimpanzees as a _____ was criticized for inferring human motives.

Because insect communities serve as a sort of barometer, _______ conditions in their environment, an entomologist’s analysis of the insect species in a handful of soil can reveal much about the ecosystem.
In stark contrast to the vague and often rambling comments of other students, Jessica’s remarks were refreshingly _____.
Nineteenth-century Plains Indians valued _____ quite highly and expected their elites to be the most giving of all.
The works of Paraguayan artist Carlos Colombino are ______: they include sculpture, painting, printmaking, and architecture.
Some actors have complained that the director, rather than treating them as his equals, dominated them and expected them to be _____.
The Prime Minister handled the crisis calmly and dispassionately, thereby enhancing his reputation for being _____.
Writing in a straightforward as opposed to _____ style, the author produced lucid argument that shed new light on a controversial topic.
The scientist ______ the value of an interdisciplinary approach to environmental studies, arguing such an approach was of paramount importance in promoting environmental literacy among students.
In retrospect, the presidency of Dwight Eisenhower is perceived as _____ period because it was relatively free of domestic turmoil.
The dictator ______ democracy as the meddling of ordinary citizens in government affairs.
The two friends occasionally indulged in _____, as they both enjoyed a bout of good-natured teasing.
Never an absolutist, but tending instead to see both sides of an issue, the senator was considered _____ by those who did not know her well.
The passengers experienced an intimacy not uncommon among vacationers spending days together, an intimacy more often due to _____ than to any community of taste.
Chairperson and CEO Andrea Jung has revitalized her company, considered ____ in recent years, to one whose products now attract millions of consumers worldwide.
Jessica was _____ by Jon’s angry outburst: she literally did not know what to say, think, or do.
In Dorothy West’s novel The Living Is Easy, the main character feels limited by her father’s authority, resenting his attempts to check her ______.
Believing that the problem could be solved if enough information were garnered, the scientist vowed to ______ her research as long as some likelihood of obtaining additional data existed.
Once the animal’s usual sources of nourishment have been exhausted, acorns are its only means of _____.
Although many of the students had found the assignment _______, Harrison completed it with ease.
Juan is _____ examining his own feelings and motives: he cannot tolerate introspection.
The new governor attempted to win the public's sympathy by casting himself as the _____ inheritor of his predecessor’s fiscal mismanagement.
Rebecca knew that to finish her project she must overcome her tendency toward _____ and learn to make up her mind.
Jane Eyre is among the most _____ of feminist novels: it is still widely read more than 150 years after its publication.
Led by Massasoit and William Bradford, the Wampanoag communities and Plymouth Colony created a military and economic _____, drawing upon one another's resources for decades.
Jason’s gullibility was remarkable: he trusted the most outrageous assertions and was therefore much too easily _____.

Because curiosity is deemed the essence of the scientific temperament, theoretical physicist Richard Feynman, renowned for his ceaseless questioning, was regarded by some as an _______ of the scientific spirit.
The editorial charged that some contemporary music ______ fundamental social values by glamorizing what is essentially an outlaw lifestyle.
Nothing in the essay is _____: every sentence contributes in an essential way to the overall meaning.
Morale among the staff scientists _______ when the director dolefully announced that chances of the project’s receiving additional funding were infinitesimal.
The slogan “What goes up must come down" was so universally accepted by economists that it was considered ______.
The corporation's code of ethics is ludicrous; its principles are either _____, offering clichés in lieu of guidance, or so unspecific as to make any behavior permissible.
Sally, thoroughly convinced of her own importance, often acts without _____: she feels no guilt, for example, about appropriating her brother's possessions.
While tributyltin (TBT) is generally not as dangerous as certain other toxic substances, studies of its damaging effects on marine life show it is ______ to mollusk fisheries.
Eager to maintain the party’s lighthearted atmosphere, the host skillfully averted a quarrel between two of his guests with ______ change of subject.
Although normally cheerful and energetic, Nathan was noticeably _______ during the week preceding the announcement of the pending job transfers.
The editor removed large portions of the manuscript, _______ entire paragraphs that she considered either erroneous or offensive.
On Gold Mountain is both ______ and universal: by recounting her Chinese American relatives’ lives, Lisa See also illuminates the larger story of the immigrant experience in the United States.
The defendant’s ______ demeanor on the witness stand tended to reinforce the jury’s impression that he had little respect for the law.

Civil rights activist Fannie Lou Hamer’s statement “I’m sick and tired of being sick and tired” was an intentional ______ that illustrated Hamer’s frustration about the plight of African Americans in the 1960s.
It was not until Dr. Anna Reinstein synthesized the results of her several different research projects that the findings _______ into a single, definitive pattern.
Benjamin Franklin was renowned for being a ______, having delved deeply into fields diverse as politics, business, diplomacy, statecraft, science, and publishing.
Readers who delight in rarefied words cannot help but be _____ by the esoteric lexicon Annie Dillard expertly wields in her novel The Maytrees.
Media reports alleged that the candidate’s campaign strategy was designed to ______ her opponent's chances for election by defaming his reputation.
The widely documented correlation between these two diseases has prompted scientists to undertake studies to determine if treating one can ________ the other.
Essentially a blues artist, Robert Cray plays music influenced by progressive rock, yet he remains ______ the blues tradition.
The new composite material exhibits an extraordinary degree of _______, which enables it to be molded into almost any shape.
The forest ranger cautioned the hikers that their proposed route might prove dangerous, but they ignored her ______.
Eager to improve upon their journalistic skills, Inés and Juanita were disappointed in their editor for criticisms that were often more captious than _______.
Zoologists hope to learn whether minor variations in the migration routes of certain animals are intentional or merely ________.
In winning the Man Booker Prize, novelist Kiran Desai achieved an honor that had _____ her mother, Anita Desai, who was a runner-up three times but never won.
In the zany comedy series I Love Lucy, Lucille Ball’s exaggerated, clumsy antics displayed the comedian’s famous talent for ______.
What had begun as good-natured teasing quickly gave way to ______ as the lost hikers blamed one another for their predicament.
Although some critics maintain that his latest book can be situated in a specific genre, it draws liberally on several different genres and so can rightly be termed ________.
Deer overbrowsing has dramatically reduced plant diversity in many eastern United States forests; the few surviving plant species are those that regrow quickly or that deer find ______.
The teacher unabashedly used ______, flattering his students in an attempt to coax them to undertake research projects for extra credit.
No _____ the case exists: in reaching a decision, the court is bound to break new legal ground.
Her actions did nothing but good, but since she performed them out of self-interest, they could not be called _____.
Max Roach is regarded as a progenitor of modem jazz drumming because he was one of the first artists to ______ the melodic, rather than merely rhythmic, possibilities of his instrument.
Since codfish are _____ part of the marine ecosystem, their extinction would adversely affect the animals who depend on them as a source of food.
The gifted child-poet Minou Drouet, hailed in the 1950s as an artistic prodigy, now lives in relative ______, enjoying a privacy unavailable to her as a child.
The legislator is known on Capitol Hill for his oratorical spontaneity, his ability to deliver _______ speech.
Ms. Nunez was _____, remaining assured and self-controlled even in the most volatile of situations.
The delegates’ behavior at the convention was utterly disgraceful and fully deserving of the _____ it provoked.
Gwen's ambitious desert hike was impeded by the heat that sapped her strength and resolve, leaving her debilitated and _______.
Because of their spare, white appearance, ancient Greek statues in modern museums are often considered austere; yet newly unearthed antiquities showing traces of bright pigment are not so _______.
Former news anchor Dan Rather had ______ for colorful locutions: for example, he once described a political race as “Spandex tight.”
Lim Cao describes her novel Monkey Bridge as autobiographical “in mood rather than fact," claiming it depicts emotional, not _____, truth.
Because Alejandra and Raina have never allowed their differences of opinion to come between them, their friendship remains _____.
In a grievous example of ______ behavior, the consultants repeatedly managed to dupe the team of scientists by presenting fabricated data.
Elephants have a sense of smell that is remarkably ______: they can reportedly smell water up to several miles away.
Some environmentalists fear that the practices contributing to global warming are so _____ in industrialized nations that there are no simple ways to mitigate their effects.
The testimony of the witness meant to _____ the defense of the man accused of theft, actually strengthened the case of his accusers.
Newspaper advertisers feel their messages are more believable and persuasive when they are printed next to news reports; hence, advertising charges are higher for such _____.
Despite accusations to the contrary, it is unlikely that he intended to _____ the articles, since he cited them in his bibliography.
Ralph Ellison learned the hard way about the ______ of a written manuscript: he suffered the destruction of the only draft of a work in progress in a household fire.
The new human resources director is both determined and _____ about being able to improve employment opportunities for women at the executive level: she has great resolve but harbors no illusions.
Years of neglect had left the inside of the building in _____ condition: workstations were filthy and furnishings were dilapidated.
The Wild Parrots of Telegraph Hill is only _____ about birds; despite its title, the documentary actually examines human relationships.
Heckling during a political rally is so ______ that it surprises no one; the same behavior, however, is startling when it is exhibited at a scientific conference.
Steve was _____ by the intricacy of the ice crystals forming on his windowpane: he couldn't take his eyes off them.
The experiment did not yield the decisive outcome that the scientist had hoped for; instead, the findings were only of ______ significance.
NASA engineer Gloria Yamauchi uses _____ approach to research, in that it draws on physics, aerodynamics, mathematics, and other fields.
Less confident employees tend to be _____ about asking for a pay increase, preferring to wait for their supervisors to raise the issue.

Although children's books about animals and plants are often fanciful rather than accurate in their descriptions, a skillful elementary-school teacher can still _____ such texts for meaningful scientific learning.
Because she was a successful entrepreneur who donated large amounts of money to charitable causes, Madame C. J. Walker is remembered today as both a ______ and a philanthropist.
The ferocity of the scientist's rebuttal of the hypothesis was startling even in the notoriously ______ world of nineteenth-century geology.
Like cartoonists, some painters seek to communicate character ______, but this economy of means is not artistic shallowness.
Certain museum antiquities are of questionable legal status, tainted by histories of bribery, thievery, and other _____ activities.
The shrewd dictator publicized the prosperity of one small village in order to _____ the magnitude of the economic hardships that plagued most of his country.
With his unlaundered shirt and his wrinkled suit, Ted appeared ______.
The estranged friends attempted ______, but their deep-seated enmity made the resumption of cordial relations impossible.
Ramona practiced ceaselessly, but even such _____ efforts could not compensate for the poor performance of her teammates.
Although retiring, nearly self-effacing, in her personal affairs, the journalist displays in her articles and columns an overriding ______ publicity and controversy.
There was so much _______ in the recent senatorial campaign that voters tuned out, disgusted with the barrage of malicious accusations.

Recent advances indicate that cures for some seemingly intractable diseases are now within reach, but scientists are being ______ in their public statements, mindful of past claims that proved erroneous.
Nuclear engineer Meena Mutyala argues that nuclear power is an environmentally ______ technology, operating with essentially no emissions.

Harper Lee cannot be called prolific writer as she has published only one major work; however, her writing in that novel is so ______, so sharply perceptive, that it has earned her enduring popularity.
The term "dry cleaning" is something of a _______, since this process generally involves application of perchloroethylene, a liquid chemical.
For thousands of years. nomads, conquerors, traders, and pilgrims have ______ the region, contributing to its multicultural heritage and its wealth of artifacts.
Displaying a heightened sense of ______, many of author María Cristina Mena's characters exemplify a dignified and polite society.
Dr. Yuan headed a medical team that was highly ______, in that it represented multifarious specialties and varied experiences.
The bee hummingbird has an average length of only two inches, making it the most ______ of all hummingbird species.
Naturally, _____ facilitates friendships: the people we live near or interact with frequently are more likely to become our friends.
Able to survive subzero temperatures, long periods of darkness, and days without food, the Arctic wolf is clearly a very _____ animal.
Ellen respects Gary’s qualities of broad-mindedness and humanism; she cannot, however, reconcile them with his ______ support of a political creed that seems to oppose precisely those qualities.

The paucity of autobiographical documents left by the royal attendants has compelled historian Raul Salazar to surmise the motives of these courtiers from their _____ rather than from any diaries or correspondence.
The painter lamented the evanescence of beauty, even though she seemed in several of her works to have _____ it as it passed and so preserved it for posterity.
Doctors initially feared that antibiotics would have ______ effect, destroying healthy tissue as well as harmful bacteria.

Native American potters often _____ the shortcuts offered by modern technology (such as the use of commercial clay, pigments, or kiln firing ), instead adhering to the traditional methods of their ancestors.
Tchaikovsky's Nutcracker leaves an _____ impression on audiences: children especially remember the dazzling costumes and stirring music.
Although certainly talented, the child could not really be called a prodigy: there was nothing particularly ______ about his achievements.
The tranquil story recounted by Ezra Jack Keats in The Snowy Day ______ the calm presence of the book's illustrations: both evoke the silence of a snow- covered landscape.
Jean-Michel Basquiat's ascendancy was truly _______: his provocative art suddenly propelled him from New York street artist to international celebrity.
Because these speeding particles' compositions were quite different from those of other low-energy cosmic rays, scientists dubbed them ______ cosmic rays.
The artist, often so ______ as to seem unapproachable, tended to be more relaxed and easygoing when among friends.
For centuries, Mars has been called the “Red Planet,” but the designation is ______, because Mars is not precisely red.
In his essay, writer Rudolfo Anaya strives to ______ his sometimes incongruous Mexican and American identities by combining divergent worldviews to create one unique vision.
The mayor's reelection by an overwhelming majority was not so much an endorsement of his administration's policies as it was a ______ of his opponent's extreme views.
Lina Wertmüller's film Love and Anarchy is a _______ its title, contemplating the two concepts without taking a position on them.
City leaders practiced austerity out of respect for taxpayers, _______ the number of new public projects.
To call Carlos _______ would be to mistake his natural self-confidence and youthful high spirits for willful defiance.
According to his supervisor, Kenji was an inveterate _______: he habitually put off doing his work until the last minute.
Although pre-Columbian jewelry often incorporated complex religious symbolism, its function was generally more decorative than _______.
Mayor Hardy remains firm in her ______, refusing to adopt an expedient silence on controversial issues of social importance.
Unlike her predecessor's rambling prose, Susan Hubell's reports were both ______ and comprehensive.
The sentimentality of Tom's screenplay was so extreme that it bordered on _______.
Honey, which has antibacterial properties, is commonly used in traditional medicine as a balm to ______ painful wounds.
The ability to cram computer circuitry onto silicon chips faces fundamental limitations: it is possible to make the innards of a circuit so ______ that they no longer function.
Citing irrefutable evidence of corruption, the investigating committee _____ the senator for his misconduct.
Astronomer Heidi Hammel, a proponent of science education, conveys a passion for planetary science that her enraptured audiences find _______.
Joe claimed always to be _____ in a crisis, but Kameko insisted that he was, on the contrary, easily ruffled.
The politician was a clever speaker whose debating skills were admired even by the ______ she outwitted.
Michiko Shoda was not of noble rank when she married into the Japanese imperial family; she was the first _______ to do so.
After years of taking art history courses and visiting museums, Ed considered himself a true _______ of fine art.
The candidate ________ the media's charge of political inexperience by citing his broad background in both local and state government.
As reformers, Martin Luther King, Jr., and Malcolm X each sought to _______ social injustice by distinctly different means.
While the movie employs stock characterizations, admirers argue that it is compelling even if its depictions are ________.

Believing that scientists should edify the public about important scientific issues, marine ecologist Jane Lubchenco has urged the research community to abandon its usual _______ in favor of more effective communication.
Some ecosystems are more _______ than others, better able to withstand changes, while other ecosystems are more vulnerable and therefore susceptible to the slightest alteration.
During decades of oppression, the people lost their will to resist and became ________, yielding readily to the government's demands.
Ryan's _______ bothered his friends, who tired of his instability and constant changes of allegiance.

Hypatia of Alexandria, a noted mathematician in Roman Egypt who also taught philosophy and astronomy, championed rationalism, deliberately ________ the mystical thinking and occult practices prevalent during her times.
The mayor is renowned for her _______ temperament: she can be warm and talkative one moment, aloof and supercilious the next.
The proposed research projects were praised as both economical and ________: they were inexpensive yet promised to break new ground.
As health care and nutrition continue to improve, Americans on average are enjoying increased ________, living to a more advanced age than ever before.
The speaker _______ frequently, but these tangents were the most entertaining parts of the presentation.
Although she often described reason as the noblest ______, author Ayn Rand never implied that she rejected emotion.
The governor concluded that, because the city's fiscal problems were ______ by entrenched mismanagement, providing rescue funding would be foolhardy.
Using fiber optics to deliver information initially seemed a _______ field of research, hard to understand by nonspecialists.
The professor's classroom manner was quite _______, never revealing the warmth and playfulness she showed in private.
Instead of taking notes during the interview, the journalist recorded the celebrity's remarks on tape and later ________ them.
Like several other important advances in medicine, penicillin was a somewhat _______ discovery resulting from favorable combination of blind chance and technical expertise.
Author Luis Zalamea calls novel writing a _______ experience, one that cleanses him of feelings of rebellion and frustration.
The scientist was meticulous in her evaluation of her own research, choosing to analyze and report on seemingly _______ results as well as those that were more expected.
Writer John Worthen suggested that, in some cases, biographers should be inclusive, considering all available details rather than making ________ a first principle.
Grover Pease Osborne's 1893 economics treatise was remarkably _______ since it foresaw that technological advances would increase the availability of natural resources.
Due to the persistence of architect Benjamin Banneker, the remarkable street plan for Washington, D.C., that had nearly been abandoned was ______ and carried out.
Because marine algae indirectly remove atmospheric carbon dioxide, a major reduction in marine algae populations might result in ______ levels of carbon dioxide.
Keats's poetry was called ______ by those critics who noted that he indulged in sensuous imagery and luxuriant diction.
Even when offstage, the acting troupe exhibited the _____ behavior usually associated with histrionic temperaments.
Danielle was easily the most _____ of her classmates, rarely willing to compromise or even listen to others' pleas.
While most pets are relatively _____ in a veterinarian’s office, occasionally vets have to treat more aggressive animal patients.

Biodemographer S.Jay Olshansky regards commercial products that promise to stop aging as _______, arguing that while these nostrums might possibly forestall some of aging's superficial manifestations, they cannot touch the process at its core.
Rosario ______ on the problem at length, but no amount of extended reflection could provide her with a satisfactory solution.
Because Russell was such a memorable and adroit public speaker, many people mistook his ability to talk about a wide range of topics for genuine ______.
Dave Anderson, founder of a national restaurant chain, promotes ________, encouraging others to start their own businesses.
The English monarch Elizabeth I may have wanted the miniature portraits of herself and her disgraced mother kept secret, since they were ______ her ring.
Aware that his party's harsh image was a direct result of its distasteful policies, the candidate espoused a kinder, more _______, political platform.
Edgar's ______ at having bungled the simple assignment was clear from his trembling lips and averted eyes.
While many educators have hailed the new documentary about climate change as a boon for teachers interested in engaging their students on the issue, such enthusiasm is far from ______.
Fermat's last theorem has been called the most ______ problem in all mathematics: for over 350 years, the conjecture stymied mathematicians, until it was finally proven in 1995.
The lifestyle of modern-dance pioneer Isadora Duncan was considered ______, since it was marked by unconventional behavior and attitudes.
The normally voluble Mr. Bell was uncharacteristically ______ in discussing the film in an interview last week.
Dana's colleagues complained that she was both ______ and boastful: she spoke condescendingly and talked about herself too much.
The ______ of new orders meant that enough work had arrived to keep everyone at the plant working overtime.
Many important inventions are the result of ______; for example, Chinese alchemists accidentally discovered gunpowder while trying to create an elixir that would make their emperor immortal.
A notorious _______, the critic struck readers as being more concerned with the success of his own literary performance than with the book being reviewed.
That bison congregate in large herds suggests that they are _______ animals, yet individually they appear stolid, seemingly indifferent to their circumstances.
The most objectionable passages in the novel were ______ at the insistence of the censors.
Saul Williams has won critical acclaim as a musician, poet, and actor, demonstrating that he is both versatile and ______.
Anyone serving as transportation commissioner must become accustomed to public criticism, and indeed Henderson is now quite ______ it.
Increasingly, nurse practitioners are lessening the heavy workload of physicians by performing medical tasks once thought to be the exclusive ______ of doctors.
Brenda's job was by no means ______: she actually had to work quite hard for her salary.
The first Moon explorers were rarely expansive in describing their surroundings; on the contrary, their reports tended to be _______.
The ______ that met the novella upon publication was so disproportionate to its modest achievement that even the author wondered whether the response was truly deserved.
The participants in the study considered themselves _______, but in yielding to the wishes of the group, they were assuming collective values.
Basset hounds tend to be _______ breed of dog: most are not easily aroused into action.
Mary Somerville's career was that of a true _______: she wrote on astronomy, mathematics, physics, and geography, among other subjects.
Eager to appear sophisticated and learned, Vincent cultivated a persona that was both urbane and _________.
Because the perfumer possessed an unusually sensitive nose, he had the ability to ______ subtle variations in even the most complex odors.
The official's record was both _______ and undistinguished: he missed many important votes and never led any legislative initiatives.
Irene is _______ compliments, feeling that they are often nothing but empty flattery.
When elected director general of the World Health Organization, Dr.Margaret Chan promised to work _______, to be unflagging in her efforts to produce results.

Some deep-sea creatures discovered by marine biologists seem to _______ the imagination, so great is the disparity between these creatures and the more familiar marine organisms found in shallower waters.
The vocation of literary criticism should in no way inhibit the critic's pleasure in a work of art; at the same time, however, such enjoyment should not ______ judgment.
It is not surprising that the writings of this philosopher are among the most ______ in the field, because he deliberately makes them easy to understand.
The meeting had _______ effect on Hannah: she found that her concerns about the new policy were adequately addressed.
In 2008, Muslims in the United States were the religious group most evenly ______ the political spectrum: 29 percent liberal, 38 percent moderate, 25 percent conservative.
As one of history's most visible proponents of ______, this activist lectured internationally on the evils of alcohol consumption.
By altering many aspects of natural river ecosystems, some dams cause serious harm, producing ______ effects on water, land, wildlife, and even the atmosphere.
The company was so _______, so unwilling to change, that it lost any ability to compete in a volatile market.
Although it is natural to take umbrage at acerbic remarks, Latoya always went to great pains to act as though she was not _______ when people harshly criticized her.
Not wishing to incur the disapproval of her teachers, who were generally conservative, Helen was _______ attempting radical new artistic styles in her paintings.
Far from exhausting him, the more arduous work schedule seems to have _____ the convalescent doctor.

As head of the National Education Association in 1965-66, Elizabeth Duncan Koontz advocated higher salaries for teachers because she believed that the more ______ teaching is, the greater its attraction for highly qualified people.
Although in public life Simone de Beauvoir's feminist stance was uncompromising, her personal life revealed a greater degree of ideological _______.
Noting a _____ of robins around his home, the bird-watcher wondered whether this reflected an overall diminution in this species' population.
The critic wrote that Hoffman's novel was ______, so abominable, in fact, that slamming it shut was the only pleasure it provided.
Although the commentator claimed to be politically neutral, she was quite obviously ______: her broadcasts always revealed an unmistakable, unreasoning bias toward her pet political causes.
Dr. Abraham often understated his accomplishments, even at times ______ the way he had achieved his success against overwhelming obstacles.
The researcher adroitly _____ his presentation with personal anecdotes, breaking up dauntingly technical material with short accounts of biographical interest.
Margot O'Toole's allegations of _______ practices among her scientific colleagues precipitated a charged debate regarding the ethics of scientific research.
Like avid gardeners who attack weeds tirelessly, some damselfish are _______ weeders of algae gardens in coral reefs.
As Sam's behavior was a flagrant violation of basic civility, Kendra was right to call it ______.
The engineers heard the claims about the new software with skepticism, but the demonstration of the software was so _______ that it won them over.
Because the candidate had switched his party allegiance immediately before the campaign, his former associates called him a traitor, and even his new allies considered him an ______.
All copies of Verna Hart's poster commemorating the 1992 Charlotte Jazz Festival were sold in a few hours, an unmistakable indication of the ______ of this artist's work.
Although Virginia Woolf was a central figure in London's established literary scene, she nevertheless perceived herself as being _______.
Although strangers compliment the comedian on her work repeatedly, almost ______, she is always moved by such enthusiastic encouragement.
ln contrast to the ______ maneuvers of his colleagues, Roberto's business relations were always open and aboveboard.
This medical study shuns _____ in describing the drug's dangers; the appeal is to rational evaluation rather than to fear.
Alexis complained that Jim ______ too quickly when their parents imposed a curfew: instead of negotiating, he complied without protest.
Once thought to be extinct, the dawn redwood was rediscovered in the 1940's, at which time its continued survival seemed _______; today, however, it is commonly cultivated.
As the name suggests, a geochronologist is a scientist who analyzes terrestrial materials in order to ______ them.
Contemporary Inuit sculpture merges traditional carving techniques with current subject matter; thus, it _____ an Inuit practice while fashioning a modem cultural identity.
Although many novelists write for artistic reasons, others are lured by the money, because popular success in writing can be so ______.
The company manager was known for both his _____ and his panache: he lied frequently, but did so with amazing flair.
Crucial to the expedition's success will be accurate assumptions about the weather: without them, the safety of the mountain climbers may be ______.
The university's aggressive transformation from a teaching-centered college to a major research institution has brought ______ that teaching is now being neglected.
Certain plant seeds are able to remain ______ for years, appearing lifeless when in fact they are merely inactive.
Wanting desperately to be perceived as learned and authoritative, Johnson affected a _____ tone when speaking in public.
Critics characterized the memoir as ______ because of the author's excessively sentimental description of her childhood.
Ernest Gaines's A Lesson Before Dying is ______ of rural Louisiana: the writing is so evocative that the Southern atmosphere seems almost to waft from the book's pages.
True vertigo is not mere dizziness but _____ motion; an involuntary, erroneous perception that one is moving.
Commentators suggested that many students of the 1950s were _______ radical politics because they saw nothing in American life against which they should revolt.
Throughout his term, Governor Clayton was considered ______ and ineffectual: he said little and did even less.
The movie star's often infuriating behavior on the set had few lasting effects: he was so adept at ______ his colleagues’ irritation with a joke that he easily restored their equanimity.
The archaeologist's examination of the evidence was remarkably careful and thorough: indeed, it was nothing short of ______.
Carla draws ______ responses, reactions characterized by verbal abuse, from those who disagree with her most strongly.
Anishinabe activist Winona LaDuke has worked to ______ many parcels of tribal land that, over decades, have been lost through sales or foreclosures.
The route was not ______; it was mazelike, confusing, and difficult to follow.
Evan imperiously demanded that he be awarded a much-needed raise or be dismissed, an ultimatum that ______ when he was summarily terminated.
Many animals are able to ______ the harmful effects of cold weather by means of feathers, fur, or blubber.
To students accustomed to using calculators, the textbook's suggestion that computations be made by hand was ______.
Many people mistakenly imagine that life in space is full of excitement; in reality, an astronaut's day includes many tasks so ______ as to be boring.
Marine biologists consider sea otters ______ eaters because otters select only two or three kinds of prey out of thirty potential food sources.
Patricia Roberts Harris is considered a ______, having been the first African American woman to serve in a presidential cabinet.
In an effort to _____ her writing, Lauren attempted to eliminate the verbosity and make only points that were truly necessary.
The foundation has been appropriately labeled _____ of the arts, as many painters and artists have received its financial support.
The senator never formally declared her opposition to the proposed legislation; instead, she engineered a series of ______ actions that ultimately forestalled passage of the bill.
Costa Rican-born artist Jimenez Deredia works on a ____ scale: the sculptures he creates are truly immense.
Gertrude Stein's life demonstrates her ______, her refusal ever to give up without having achieved her goal.
Around strangers, Ravi appeared diffident; but once he was with his friends, his self-confidence returned, and he became more ______.
Despite the burgeoning of popular interest in rain forests and medicinal plants, there is a ______ easy-to-use field guides.
While the manager clearly sought to ______ the optimism of the marketing team, she stopped short of pronouncing their plan unfeasible.
Magician Harry Houdini performed spectacular feats of escape so astounding that they became legendary; even now, his name has a ______ aura for generations who never saw him perform.
This new report focuses on how seemingly ______ technological design features, often cosmetic in nature, can actually influence consumers’ decisions in profound ways.
Some medieval European painters saw iniquity all around them: they felt that the visible world was _____ sin.
Because the editors refused to take a stand on controversial subjects, their magazine acquired a reputation for intellectual ______.
She vowed to proclaim her innocence until she was ______, cleared from blame for any involvement in the conspiracy.
When evidence is ______, reasonable people may demur, but when firm scientific proof has been supplied, they should reconsider their opposition.
Though usually sparing in her praise, the teacher was _____ in acknowledging Chandra's achievements: she could not say enough positive things.
In the early twentieth century, a ______ decimated American chestnut tree populations; relatively few of these stately trees now remain.
Maxwell Perkins is considered a particularly ______ editor because he was among the first to recognize the extraordinary literary talent of Ernest Hemingway and Thomas Wolfe.
As a college professor, Woodrow Wilson was _____ in all things: he brought the same exacting attention to detail to preparing his lectures and arranging his office furniture.
Frances Keller's 1904 exposé of abuses of immigrants by employers spurred a political reaction: it inspired the Progressive Party to work toward legislation to _____ the situation.
Although many swimmers fear encountering jellyfish in the ocean, most species are actually _____ and do no harm to humans.
If Williams had a fault, it was an almost complete trust in others, a proclivity bordering on ______.
Manuel was so ______ that he would gladly spend months without more than perfunctory contact with other people.
Judy Dater's photographs depict everyday reality while also evoking qualities so ______ that few photographers can capture them.
The visually striking movie was diminished by its ______ content; its characters were inane, and its story was unintelligent.
Diego Velazquez, Francisco de Goya, and El Greco, three of the most distinctive and influential artists in Spain's history, together form the great ______ of Spanish painting.
The impasse has proved to be ______: as a result, negotiations have been suspended indefinitely.
To study predators one must adopt the role of _______, that is, refrain from interfering with an animal's natural behavior.
Most human behavior is conventional; that is, it tends to ______ a norm.
The experts could not believe that a beginner had created such an accomplished work: they found the idea ______.
The magazine article discussing the governor’s financial dealings contained exaggerated statements, but it stopped short of being ______.
The deterioration of the ozone layer is ______, with the loss of penguin habitats being just one of the deleterious results.
Literally meaning "without care," a _____ is a job that requires little work yet provides an income.
Climbing the steep mountainside could make even experienced climbers _______; not surprisingly, June, a novice, felt dizzy while still at the bottom.
Compelled by powerful impulses to ______ her energies on myriad unworthy projects, Emilia nonetheless dazzled observers with the sheer magnitude of that profligacy.
When acid rain attacks stone, it does not remain confined to the surface; instead, it ------- the stone.

By citing data from nations where female scientists earn less than equivalent male counterparts, the author attempted to ______ the claim that discrimination still lingers in the scientific workplace.
Wanting to appear both commanding and ______, the official tried to cultivate an authoritative yet solicitous public image.
The scientists hypothesized that the newly discovered virus multiplies by _____ living cells, where the viral genetic material uses the cellular materials of the host to manufacture new viruses.
The success of the space program came as a pleasant surprise to a nation that had been ______ by political turmoil and social unrest.
Cottontail rabbits are known for being remarkably _______, some individual females producing up to 35 offspring a year.
Although most people in the early years of the Internet explored only legitimate uses of computer networks, some unscrupulous people took advantage of the technology's potential for _______.
Difficult working conditions that ranged from merely ______ to extremely intimidating were the norm for jazz performer Billie Holiday.
Jessica's smile _______ her sorrow, hiding her feelings from everyone except those who knew her best.
In contrast to chimpanzees, who are extroverted exhibitionists, orangutans are _______ by nature.
Recognizing that time was a critical factor, the paramedics responded to the call with ______.
The newest member of the research team, not wanting to appear ______, refrained from venturing any criticism of the principal scientist's plan for completing the project.
Because his themes and use of imagery are highly eccentric, painter Sigmar Polke is said to have _____ style.
Some scientists believe that Adélie penguins may be _____ of global warming, that their population decline may presage climatic changes throughout Antarctica.
Articles for the magazine are always subjected to painstaking scrutiny before publication: fact checkers and editors _____ them for potential errors before they are sent to the printer.
Unlike her more dynamic friends, Danielle is ______ , preferring sleep to almost any kind of activity.
The only ______ on the flat desert landscape was the occasional rock outcrop jutting skyward.
The sanitized version of the Madame Curie saga had the dishonest quality of _____ the problems that even she, the great scientist, could not overcome.
Commercial trade in endangered species of whales was suspended globally in 1986, but this ______ may end for some species.
The city council's unanimous rejection of a proposal so critical to the mayor's agenda was a shocking ______ for the mayor, because she had fully expected the council's support.
The actor's reputation as a distinguished public figure suffered after an embarrassing personal incident made him more ______ than illustrious.
Because their previous supervisor had been especially lenient and understanding, the staff members were ______ the authoritarian style of the new director.
The city's _____ atmosphere resulted from its location at the crossroads of trade routes used by merchants of many nations.
Newscasts are routinely filled with such sensational stories that the public is seldom ______ by even the most lurid revelations.
During the 1950s, talented African American actresses like Dorothy Dandridge were often ______, relegated to playing mostly stereotypical roles.

Aerospace engineer Dr. Aprille Ericsson-Jackson does not ______ her responsibilities as a role model; instead, she embraces the opportunity to encourage women and minorities to pursue careers in math and science.
Steve tempers his ambition with ______: despite his intense desire to succeed, he remains sensitive to the feelings of others.
The senator delivered such ______ speech that her supporters, inspired by her obvious fervor, were moved to action.
The ancient Greek writer Herodotus was inordinately _____, blithely accepting wildly improbable legends as historical facts.

Alarmed that land-clearing practices are rapidly destroying crucial habitat, the government of Madagascar is working hard to _____ in its citizens a sense of pride in the nation's diverse animal and plant species.
Not even a microscope is sufficiently powerful to view the ______ molecules that chemist Jacqueline Barton designs.
The conclusion of such a vast and complex book should have contained a _____ of the author's ideas to complement the general remarks he made in the introduction.
The psychologist's ostensibly objective experiments were in fact ______: they subtly yet invariably supported her personal predilections.
The commentator's misuse of language and reliance on inappropriate colloquialisms and jargon are considerable ______ the audience’s comprehension.
Although Michael’s invidious accusations aroused our ______, we managed to preserve our equanimity and remain composed.
The signs that the skeleton had been tampered with were so _____ that the archaeologist almost failed to notice them.

In the past, paintings by Black American artists often were ______; in contrast, many art critics today advocate an understanding of the works of Black artists as essential to appreciating America's diverse heritage.
Although optimists often encourage people to anticipate success, an excessive confidence in future outcomes may be unrealistic, even _______.

Studying gray whales during the 1970s, marine biologist Mary Lou Jones dubbed one of her subjects “Amazing Grace,” for its friendliness was astonishing and its movements underwater ______ beyond description.
The _____ nature of the virus allows it to continually change its form and thus go undetected by the body's immune system.
The city reveals its unique type of _____ most fully during the cheerful and noisy New Year's celebrations, which attract international as well as local participants.
